Comments_List: I would describe this as a "theorem theorem theorem" course (of course, with some proofs and sketches) rather than "theorem proof theorem proof." It was great for getting an understanding of what results are out there, their main techniques, and where to look for more information.

Knowledge:
- Time series econometrics, including limit theorems, unit roots, and cointegration analysis.
- Empirical processes
- High-dimensional statistics

Skills: 
- Statistical problem solving

Strengths: The lecture slides were a great resource. The syllabus referenced many useful books.

Weaknesses: It could have been nice to have more practice applying the content we reviewed in class.
Yes, I got a lot of new ideas out of it.
I would recommend the course to students interested in specializing in econometrics.
